chapter.title: Modifying the Entry-scale KVM with VSA Model for Your Environment
chapter.para: This section covers the changes that need to be made to the input model to deploy and run this cloud model in your environment.
This section is written from the perspective of the entry-scale-kvm-vsa example, although the same principles apply to all of the examples.
There are two categories of modifications that we will look at:

listitem.para: Localizations - These are the minimum set of changes that you need to make to adapt the examples to run in your environment. These are mostly concerned with networking. See .
Customizations - These describe more general changes that you can make to your model, e.g. changing disk storage layouts. See

chapter.para: Note that, as a convention, the examples use upper case for the object names, but these strings are only used to define the relationships between objects and have no specific significance to the configuration processor. You can change the names to values that are relevant to your context providing you do so consistently across the input model.
